titleStmt.title: Frank Krebs and Pat Daughtery v. King County. Affidavit

bibl.title: Frank Krebs and Pat Daughtery v. King County. Affidavit
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p: Territory of Washington Plaintiff Pat Doherty and Frank Krebs Defendents Information. In Justice's Court. Before JOHN F. MILLER, Justice of the Peace. Territory of Washington, County of King. ss. John Nelson being first duly sworn, on oath says that at White River in said King County, on the 7 day of October 1889 Pat Doherty and Frank Krebs did unlawfully willfully and unlawfully attempt in a rude misolent and angry manner unlawfully to touch, strike, beat and wound another person, to writ this affiant. Said Pat Doherty, and Frank Krebs then and there having a present ability to carry such attempt into execution. contrary to the form of the Statute in such case made and provided, and against the peace and dignity of the Territory of Washington. x : John Nelson Subscribed and sworn to before me this 8 day of October 1889 John F Miller Justice of the Peace, Seattle Precinct, King County, W.T.

Territory of Washington Count of King ss. J. John F Miller, Justice of the Peace in and for Seattle Precinct King County Wash. Terry do hereby certify that the writing is a one full complete and correct copy of the original conflict or information on file before me in the within cause and that the said Pat Doherty gives his name as Pat Daugherty. Date of this 11th day of Oct. John F Miller Justice of the Peace in and for Seattle Precinct King County W.T.
7306 No. 2255 Information. Territory of Washington vs. Pat Doherty and Frank Krebs assault
Filed Oct 16 1889 R.M. Hopkins Filled, Oct 8th 1889 John F Miller Justice of the Peace, Seattle Precintct, King County, W.T.
